item.title: Hardening Your Computer's Security by Disabling SSL and TLS 1.2 and Below
item.category: "Hardening computer security" , "Disabling SSL and TLS" , "Data security" , "POODLE" , "BEAST" , "Heartbleed" , "Windows registry editor" , "Linux OpenSSL configuration" , "Apache" , "Nginx"
item.description: This article discusses the steps to improve data security by disabling older versions of SSL and TLS protocols, which are vulnerable to cyber threats such as POODLE, BEAST, and Heartbleed, in Windows and Linux systems.
